comment.author: 13877445@N06
comment._content: It looks like Killkenny Beat Tipperary 4-2 to 2-6 though the date I see is 9 Sept. but the reliabilty is suspect (from Wikipedia as the GAA website is awful).  Wikipedia seems to be calling it the 1922 Championship but played in 1923 (as I first looked up the 1923 Champioship which they say was played in 1924 - arghhh).

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13877445@N06] Arghh, indeed! Now you see why I gave up  in all the confusion. Oddly though, our metadata says that Kilkenny were at Croker to play Dublin - would you say that's wildly inaccurate? Dating, etc. usually pretty good on these W.D. Hogan photos.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 13877445@N06
comment._content:
That might be at the Leinster Final.  Wiki, again, shows Kilkenny winning Leinster in both 1922 and 1923 with Dublin shown as runner-up the same years.  The Kilkenny website has them winning All-Ireland in 1922 (maybe Wiki WAS right after-all in saying the 1922 Final was held in 1923 - doesn't make much sense but maybe the whole set-up was much different)

Wow, I had no idea it was so difficult just to find a good list of champions and Finals.  The GAA needs to find a good website developer.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13877445@N06] Wondering if 1922 Final may well have been played in 1923 because of Irish Civil War??
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: If memory serves me right (No! I was not around then) from reading about All Ireland's in the past the World War, the Troubles(?) and the Civil War had thrown things out of kilter around that time.  So it is logical to think that the finals were delayed.  There was also the small matter of Bloody Sunday which would not have helped?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Well, I have an APB out on Facebook and Twitter as well - we'll get to the bottom of this one in the end!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 55597723@N02
comment._content: Fine looking Gentlemen. Bet they were a very good Team.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: The very helpful @hurlingstats over on the Twitter suggests "Other possibility is 1923 Leinster final played on 22 Jul 1923 in Croke Park. KK beat Dublin." So may well be that the day/month we have for this photo are wrong, but all else is correct: Kilkenny playing Dublin at Hurling in Croker in 1923.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: This page gives a link to some Pathé footage, and a list of the Kilkenny players for 1922-23: Walter Dunphy (capt.), Ed. Dunphy, M. McDonald (goal), John Holohan, Jas. Tobin, Thos. Carroll, Richard Grace, Wm. Kenny, Patk. Glendon, Pat Aylward, Martin Lawlor, John Roberts, Pat Donohoe, Matty Power, Richard Tobin.
